H0.text: Fog is rising from the lake is an observation the student could make while walking along a trail by a lake on a cool summer morning.

H1.text: The water is too cold for swimming is an observation the student could make while walking along a trail by a lake on a cool summer morning.

H2.text: The water is cold because it comes from melted snow is an observation the student could make while walking along a trail by a lake on a cool summer morning.

H3.text: The temperature of the air is rising because the Sun is out is an observation a student could make while walking along a trail by a lake on a cool summer morning.

A4.text: Advection fog occurs when moist air passes over a cool surface by advection (wind) and is cooled.

A5.text: Fog forms when the difference between air temperature and dew point is less than 2.5 °C (4.5 °F).
